messages.message: <!here> PSA: I just merged a PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/13709) to change the default Ari OCR provider when running the instabase stack locally from `ocr-ari`  to `ocr-service` . This means anytime you are running the stack locally and using Ari OCR, you will need to turn up `ocr-service`  instead of `ocr-ari`. Let me know if you run into any bugs or issues!

I tried updating to the latest master - I'm seeing the following error for Celery-image-tasks
```Incorrect ocr provider ocr-service```

```def _get_ocr_ari_provider():
  # type: () -> Text
  provider = os.environ.get('OCR_ARI_PROVIDER', 'ocr-ari-tservice')
  if provider not in [
      OCRAriProvider.OCR_ARI_SERVICE, OCRAriProvider.OCR_ARI_WORKER,
      OCRAriProvider.OCR_ARI_CLOUD
  ]:
    sys.exit('Incorrect ocr provider {}'.format(provider))
  return provider```
